segment.source: Audit IPsec Driver (Windows 10)
segment.target: Audit IPsec Driver (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit IPsec Driver, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events for the activities of the IPsec driver.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit IPsec Driver, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events for the activities of the IPsec driver.

segment.source: Audit IPsec Driver
segment.target: Audit IPsec Driver

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016
segment.target: Windows Server 2016

segment.source: Audit IPsec Driver allows you to audit events generated by IPSec driver such as the following:
segment.target: Audit IPsec Driver allows you to audit events generated by IPSec driver such as the following:

segment.source: Startup and shutdown of the IPsec services.
segment.target: Startup and shutdown of the IPsec services.

segment.source: Network packets dropped due to integrity check failure.
segment.target: Network packets dropped due to integrity check failure.

segment.source: Network packets dropped due to replay check failure.
segment.target: Network packets dropped due to replay check failure.

segment.source: Network packets dropped due to being in plaintext.
segment.target: Network packets dropped due to being in plaintext.

segment.source: Network packets received with incorrect Security Parameter Index (SPI).
segment.target: Network packets received with incorrect Security Parameter Index (SPI).

segment.source: This may indicate that either the network card is not working correctly or the driver needs to be updated.
segment.target: This may indicate that either the network card is not working correctly or the driver needs to be updated.

segment.source: Inability to process IPsec filters.
segment.target: Inability to process IPsec filters.

segment.source: A high rate of packet drops by the IPsec filter driver may indicate attempts to gain access to the network by unauthorized systems.
segment.target: A high rate of packet drops by the IPsec filter driver may indicate attempts to gain access to the network by unauthorized systems.

segment.source: Failure to process IPsec filters poses a potential security risk because some network interfaces may not get the protection that is provided by the IPsec filter.
segment.target: Failure to process IPsec filters poses a potential security risk because some network interfaces may not get the protection that is provided by the IPsec filter.

segment.source: This subcategory is outside the scope of this document.
segment.target: This subcategory is outside the scope of this document.

segment.source: Computer Type
segment.target: Computer Type

segment.source: General Success
segment.target: General Success

segment.source: General Failure
segment.target: General Failure

segment.source: Stronger Success
segment.target: Stronger Success

segment.source: Stronger Failure
segment.target: Stronger Failure

segment.source: Comments
segment.target: Comments

segment.source: Domain Controller
segment.target: Domain Controller

segment.source: There is no recommendation for this subcategory in this document, unless you know exactly what you need to monitor at IPsec Driver level.
segment.target: There is no recommendation for this subcategory in this document, unless you know exactly what you need to monitor at IPsec Driver level.

segment.source: Member Server
segment.target: Member Server

segment.source: There is no recommendation for this subcategory in this document, unless you know exactly what you need to monitor at IPsec Driver level.
segment.target: There is no recommendation for this subcategory in this document, unless you know exactly what you need to monitor at IPsec Driver level.

segment.source: Workstation
segment.target: Workstation

segment.source: There is no recommendation for this subcategory in this document, unless you know exactly what you need to monitor at IPsec Driver level.
segment.target: There is no recommendation for this subcategory in this document, unless you know exactly what you need to monitor at IPsec Driver level.

segment.source: 4960(S): IPsec dropped an inbound packet that failed an integrity check.
segment.target: 4960(S): IPsec dropped an inbound packet that failed an integrity check.

segment.source: If this problem persists, it could indicate a network issue or that packets are being modified in transit to this computer.
segment.target: If this problem persists, it could indicate a network issue or that packets are being modified in transit to this computer.

segment.source: Verify that the packets sent from the remote computer are the same as those received by this computer.
segment.target: Verify that the packets sent from the remote computer are the same as those received by this computer.

segment.source: This error might also indicate interoperability problems with other IPsec implementations.
segment.target: This error might also indicate interoperability problems with other IPsec implementations.

segment.source: 4961(S): IPsec dropped an inbound packet that failed a replay check.
segment.target: 4961(S): IPsec dropped an inbound packet that failed a replay check.

segment.source: If this problem persists, it could indicate a replay attack against this computer.
segment.target: If this problem persists, it could indicate a replay attack against this computer.

segment.source: 4962(S): IPsec dropped an inbound packet that failed a replay check.
segment.target: 4962(S): IPsec dropped an inbound packet that failed a replay check.

segment.source: The inbound packet had too low a sequence number to ensure it was not a replay.
segment.target: The inbound packet had too low a sequence number to ensure it was not a replay.

segment.source: 4963(S): IPsec dropped an inbound clear text packet that should have been secured.
segment.target: 4963(S): IPsec dropped an inbound clear text packet that should have been secured.

segment.source: This is usually due to the remote computer changing its IPsec policy without informing this computer.
segment.target: This is usually due to the remote computer changing its IPsec policy without informing this computer.

segment.source: This could also be a spoofing attack attempt.
segment.target: This could also be a spoofing attack attempt.

segment.source: 4965(S): IPsec received a packet from a remote computer with an incorrect Security Parameter Index (SPI).
segment.target: 4965(S): IPsec received a packet from a remote computer with an incorrect Security Parameter Index (SPI).

segment.source: This is usually caused by malfunctioning hardware that is corrupting packets.
segment.target: This is usually caused by malfunctioning hardware that is corrupting packets.

segment.source: If these errors persist, verify that the packets sent from the remote computer are the same as those received by this computer.
segment.target: If these errors persist, verify that the packets sent from the remote computer are the same as those received by this computer.

segment.source: This error may also indicate interoperability problems with other IPsec implementations.
segment.target: This error may also indicate interoperability problems with other IPsec implementations.

segment.source: In that case, if connectivity is not impeded, then these events can be ignored.
segment.target: In that case, if connectivity is not impeded, then these events can be ignored.

segment.source: 5478(S): IPsec Services has started successfully.
segment.target: 5478(S): IPsec Services has started successfully.

segment.source: 5479(): IPsec Services has been shut down successfully.
segment.target: 5479(): IPsec Services has been shut down successfully.

segment.source: The shutdown of IPsec Services can put the computer at greater risk of network attack or expose the computer to potential security risks.
segment.target: The shutdown of IPsec Services can put the computer at greater risk of network attack or expose the computer to potential security risks.

segment.source: 5480(F): IPsec Services failed to get the complete list of network interfaces on the computer.
segment.target: 5480(F): IPsec Services failed to get the complete list of network interfaces on the computer.

segment.source: This poses a potential security risk because some of the network interfaces may not get the protection provided by the applied IPsec filters.
segment.target: This poses a potential security risk because some of the network interfaces may not get the protection provided by the applied IPsec filters.

segment.source: Use the IP Security Monitor snap-in to diagnose the problem.
segment.target: Use the IP Security Monitor snap-in to diagnose the problem.

segment.source: 5483(F): IPsec Services failed to initialize RPC server.
segment.target: 5483(F): IPsec Services failed to initialize RPC server.

segment.source: IPsec Services could not be started.
segment.target: IPsec Services could not be started.

segment.source: 5484(F): IPsec Services has experienced a critical failure and has been shut down.
segment.target: 5484(F): IPsec Services has experienced a critical failure and has been shut down.

segment.source: The shutdown of IPsec Services can put the computer at greater risk of network attack or expose the computer to potential security risks.
segment.target: The shutdown of IPsec Services can put the computer at greater risk of network attack or expose the computer to potential security risks.

segment.source: 5485(F): IPsec Services failed to process some IPsec filters on a plug-and-play event for network interfaces.
segment.target: 5485(F): IPsec Services failed to process some IPsec filters on a plug-and-play event for network interfaces.

segment.source: This poses a potential security risk because some of the network interfaces may not get the protection provided by the applied IPsec filters.
segment.target: This poses a potential security risk because some of the network interfaces may not get the protection provided by the applied IPsec filters.

segment.source: Use the IP Security Monitor snap-in to diagnose the problem.
segment.target: Use the IP Security Monitor snap-in to diagnose the problem.
